result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (6th) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Gerald E Foulker was found guilty of OWI (6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: IID restriction effective upon licensure for 36 months.

miscConds.notes: $1,519 to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.

DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order.  To be collected by the Department of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervison or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
$33 to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.  $250 DNA surcharge remitted.
Maintain full-time employment/education or combination of or be seeking same, and treatment.

Defendant shall not use/possess alcohol or drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Do not drive a motor vehicle without valid DL and approval of agent.  Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with victim. No alcohol in any place he resides. No presence in bars, liquor stores or taverns.
Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample. Sobrietor for 6 months after release from custody.

timeConds.notes: W/ Huber. Provisions of good time apply. Credit does not apply.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
- Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle.
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol.
- The court orders a signature bond in the amount of $500.00 per case on the condition that the defendant reports to, and complies with, Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM).  The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail.  If defendant fails to comply with DCBM, cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $5000.00 (per case), as higher cash bail is necessary to assure appearance in court. BMP is removed as condition of bond.
Defendant waived the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
